channel.title: Texture Mods
channel.description:
I just can't figure out how to get Workshop textures to, well, [i]work[/i]. Other types of workshop content are basically plug-and-play, but I downloaded two texture mods and this was the result: [img]https://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/361778856639239073/2029A77C08DD47937015E326B2E0DC6FF806F390/[/img]
One of the mods (the [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=467215084&searchtext=Winter']Winter BM[/url] one) is pretty old, but [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=597599309']the Russian translation one[/url] was definitely published after the Great Redesign. Winter BM is no doubt responsible for most of the purple seen above, but neither mod works properly. You can see that not [i]all[/i] textures are affected, just the ones the mods try to replace.
Loading a level in this state produces many error messages of the form *** Error unserializing VTF file... is the file empty? Error reading texture header "materials/some/texture/path/texture.vtf" (but it doesn't seem like one for every single texture lost, there seem to be fewer error messages than missing textures?).
Texture mods in the content folder do not appear to contain VPKs, VTFs, or any other type of asset file I am familiar with, but rather a single file called [i][SOME LONG UNINFORMATIVE NUMBER][/i]_legacy.bin .
I'm putting this in here instead of bug reports because other people seem to be running texture mods just fine and so the problem is likely something I am doing wrong on my end.

item.title: Texture Mods
item.dc:creator: Admiral_Sakai
item.description:
Ok, looks like opting out of the public beta restores the older texture mod to working order. It should be possible to make a workaround for the newer one as well…

Read full topic

item.title: Texture Mods
item.dc:creator: Admiral_Sakai
item.description:
I’m already opted into the public beta.

Going to try toggling it on and off and see if that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Texture Mods
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
Can you opt into the public beta branch and see if that resolves the issue? Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Texture Mods
item.dc:creator: Admiral_Sakai
item.description:
I just can’t figure out how to get Workshop textures to, well, work. Other types of workshop content are basically plug-and-play, but I downloaded two texture mods and this was the result:

1600×900

One of the mods (the Winter BM one) is pretty old, but the Russian translation one was definitely published after the Great Redesign. Winter BM is no doubt responsible for most of the purple seen above, but neither mod works properly. You can see that not all textures are affected, just the ones the mods try to replace.

Loading a level in this state produces many error messages of the form
*** Error unserializing VTF file… is the file empty?
Error reading texture header “materials/some/texture/path/texture.vtf”
(but it doesn’t seem like one for every single texture lost, there seem to be fewer error messages than missing textures?).

Texture mods in the content folder do not appear to contain VPKs, VTFs, or any other type of asset file I am familiar with, but rather a single file called [SOME LONG UNINFORMATIVE NUMBER]_legacy.bin .

I’m putting this in here instead of bug reports because other people seem to be running texture mods just fine and so the problem is likely something I am doing wrong on my end.

Read full topic
